item.title: 上海港队与山东队战平后夺得中国冠军
item.description:
Shanghai Port claimed the Chinese Super League title at the end of a foul-tempered clash with nearest rivals Shandong Taishan on Sunday, picking up the point they needed with a 1-1 draw at Pudong Arena in a game that featured five red cards.翻译:周日，上海港队在浦东体育馆与实力最接近的对手山东泰山队进行了一场激烈的交锋，最终以 1-1 战平上海港队，最终获得了所需的积分，并在这场比赛中拿到了五张红牌。

Lu Wenjun had given Shanghai a 16th minute lead only for bedlam to break out late in a first half that had been growing increasingly fraught, with referee Mametjan Ahmet handing out a flurry of red cards.翻译:吕文军在第 16 分钟为上海队取得领先，但上半场后期却爆发了混乱，裁判马梅特詹·艾哈迈德 (Mametjan Ahmet) 出示了一系列红牌。

Lu was the first to be given his marching orders following a clash with Chen Pu on the edge of the six-yard box, earning him a second yellow card in the 41st minute.翻译:第41分钟，卢在六码禁区边缘与陈朴发生冲突，成为第一个被罚下场的球员，他因此获得了第二张黄牌。

Tempers flared and Shandong's Moises was sent off as a scuffle broke out all over the Shanghai penalty area, while Port were soon reduced to nine men after Ahmet consulted the pitchside monitor.翻译:上海队禁区内爆发了混战，山东队的莫伊塞斯被罚下场，而艾哈迈德向场边监视器咨询后，波特很快就减少到了九人。

The referee returned to the field to send off Cai Huikang for having earlier grabbed Moises by the throat, a decision that incensed Shanghai coach Javier Pereira and earned the Portuguese coach a red card of his own.翻译:裁判回到场上，因蔡惠康掐住莫伊塞斯喉​​咙而将其罚下，这一决定激怒了上海队主教练哈维尔·佩雷拉，并为这位葡萄牙教练自己赢得了一张红牌。

Shandong, who trailed by five points going into Sunday's match, needed to win to take the title race into the final round and went close to equalising just after the hour mark when second half substitute Fei Nanduo hit the post.翻译:在周日的比赛中，山东队落后五分，但需要获胜才能将冠军争夺带入最后一轮，并在下半场替补费南多击中门柱后，险些扳平比分。

The former Guangzhou FC winger was the next player to see red when he was dismissed for reacting angrily to a tackle by Li Shuai 15 minutes from time.翻译:这位前广州足球俱乐部边锋是下一个被红牌罚下的球员，他在比赛还剩15分钟时因对李帅的铲断做出愤怒反应而被罚下场。

Shandong did manage to pull level with a minute remaining, Xie Wenneng scoring from close range after Cryzan's initial shot from the edge of the area had been parried by Yan Junling.翻译:比赛还剩一分钟时，山东队扳平比分，克莱赞在禁区边缘的第一脚射门被颜骏凌挡出，谢文能近距离得分。

But Choi Kang-hee's side were unable to find a winner, leaving Shanghai to claim the title for the first time since 2018.翻译:但崔江熙的球队未能找到胜利者，上海队自2018年以来首次夺得冠军。

Reporting by Michael Church, editing by Pritha Sarkar翻译:迈克尔·丘奇 (Michael Church) 报道，普里莎·萨卡 (Pritha Sarkar) 编辑

item.title: 北京马拉松选手不戴口罩，不受雾霾困扰
item.description:
Runners undeterred by thick smog engulfing the Chinese capital ran the Beijing Marathon maskless on Sunday, many wearing shorts in one of the warmest Octobers on record.翻译:周日，在有记录以来最温暖的十月之一，跑者们没有被席卷中国首都的浓雾吓倒，没有戴口罩参加北京马拉松比赛，许多人都穿着短裤。

Despite a greyish brown smog settling, some 30,000 marathoners set off at 7:30 a.m. (2330 GMT) from Tiananmen Square on the route through four districts of the Chinese capital over 42.195 km (26.2 miles).翻译:尽管灰棕色烟雾逐渐消散，约 30,000 名马拉松运动员仍于早上 7:30（格林威治标准时间 2330）从天安门广场出发，路线穿过中国首都的四个区，全程超过 42.195 公里（26.2 英里）。

Beijing was the second most-polluted major city in the world on Sunday, according to Swiss air-quality technology firm IQAir.翻译:根据瑞士空气质量技术公司 IQAir 的数据，周日北京是世界上污染第二严重的主要城市。

In the Haidian district on Beijing's outskirts, the sky looked dreary, but hikers and visitors showed up at the Fragrant Hills Park where many go to enjoy autumn foliage, according to a Reuters witness.翻译:据路透社目击者称，在北京郊区的海淀区，天空显得沉闷，但徒步旅行者和游客出现在香山公园，许多人去那里欣赏秋叶。

China's national forecaster advised the public to wear masks, warning on Sunday morning that air quality was reaching moderate or severe pollution.翻译:中国国家预报员建议公众戴口罩，并在周日早上警告说，空气质量已达到中度或重度污染。

Smog and fog will blanket parts of China for the next few days, reducing visibility and affecting travel in northeastern, northern, central and some eastern provinces, the National Meteorological Center said on Sunday.翻译:国家气象中心周日表示，未来几天，我国部分地区将出现雾霾天气，能见度降低，影响东北、华北、中部和部分东部省份的出行。

Beijing's observatory cautioned in the evening that visibility in most areas of the city will drop to less than 1 km (0.62 mile) overnight.翻译:北京气象台晚间警告说，夜间该市大部分地区的能见度将降至不到 1 公里（0.62 英里）。

The smoggy weather is expected to gradually weaken and dissipate from Friday, but not before heavy fog forecast to cover parts of Jiangsu, Anhui and Sichuan provinces over the next three days could reduce visibility to less than 200 metres (650 feet), the forecaster said.翻译:预报员称，雾霾天气预计从周五开始逐渐减弱并消散，但预计未来三天江苏、安徽和四川省部分地区将出现大雾，能见度可能降至200米（650英尺）以下。

Steel production hubs in Tangshan, Handan and other cities in the northern province of Hebei launched emergency responses on Friday after heavy air pollution forecasts. The notices did not indicate when the controls would be lifted.翻译:在空气污染严重的预报后，唐山、邯郸和河北省其他城市的钢铁生产中心周五启动了应急响应。通知没有表明何时取消控制。

The smog adds unusually warm October weather, due to significantly weaker cold air currents from the north as the polar vortex that sends cold air southward was situated further north recently, experts said.翻译:专家表示，由于向南输送冷空气的极地涡旋最近位于更北的位置，来自北方的冷气流明显减弱，雾霾使十月的天气变得异常温暖。

Beijing's high on Sunday was 19 C (66 F), according to the national weather bureau.翻译:据国家气象局称，周日北京最高气温为 19 摄氏度（66 华氏度）。

Parts of China, including in the north and northeast, have been experiencing temperatures 2 to 4 degrees Celsius (4-7 Fahrenheit) higher than normal the past 10 days.翻译:过去 10 天，中国部分地区，包括北部和东北部，气温比正常水平高 2 至 4 摄氏度（4 至 7 华氏度）。

"At present, a total of 237 national meteorological stations have broken historically highest temperatures in late October, which is still a relatively rare situation," meteorological bureau's chief forecaster Fang Chong was quoted by state media as saying.翻译:官方媒体援引气象局首席预报员方冲的话说：“目前，共有237个国家气象站在10月下旬突破了历史最高气温，这仍然是比较罕见的情况。”

Weak cold air currents were forecast to last the rest of the month before beginning to cool in early November.翻译:预计弱冷气流将持续本月剩余时间，然后在 11 月初开始降温。

While the smog was expected to clear up in less than a week, the backdrop of hazy weather resembled that of Beijing's annual race almost a decade ago. In 2014 then-Premier Li Keqiang, who died on Friday, declared "war" on pollution and many marathoners donned masks for protection.翻译:虽然雾霾预计将在不到一周的时间内消散，但雾霾天气的背景与近十年前北京一年一度的赛事相似。 2014年，周五去世的时任总理李克强向污染宣战，许多马拉松运动员都戴上了口罩进行防护。

Reporting by Liz Lee and Ryan Woo; Additional reporting by Han Xiao and Bernard Orr; Editing by William Mallard翻译:Liz Lee 和 Ryan Woo 的报道；韩晓和伯纳德·奥尔的补充报道；威廉·马拉德编辑

item.title: G7呼吁立即废除日本食品禁令，向中国施压
item.description:
The Group of Seven (G7) industrial powers called on Sunday for the "immediate repeal" of import curbs on Japanese food products, a reference to China's restrictions after Japan began releasing wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear power plant.翻译:七国集团（G7）工业大国周日呼吁“立即废除”对日本食品的进口限制，指的是日本开始排放福岛核电站废水后中国的限制。

The G7 trade ministers, in a statement after a weekend meeting on Osaka, did not mention China but they also denounced what they consider its rising economic coercion through trade.翻译:七国集团贸易部长在大阪周末会议后发表的一份声明中没有提及中国，但他们也谴责了中国通过贸易日益增强的经济胁迫。

"We deplore actions to weaponize economic dependencies and commit to build on free, fair, and mutually beneficial economic and trade relationships," said the 10-page statement.翻译:这份长达 10 页的声明表示：“我们对将经济依赖武器化的行为表示遗憾，并致力于建立自由、公平和互利的经济和贸易关系。”

China slapped a blanket suspension of Japanese fish imports two months ago when Japan started the release of treated radioactive water from the wrecked Fukushima plant into the Pacific. While Japan and the U.S. have called the curbs unfair, Russia announced a similar restriction earlier this month.翻译:两个月前，当日本开始将受损福岛核电站处理过的放射性水排入太平洋时，中国全面暂停了日本鱼类进口。尽管日本和美国称这些限制措施不公平，但俄罗斯本月早些时候也宣布了类似的限制措施。

China's foreign ministry did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the G7 statement outside business hours.翻译:中国外交部没有立即回应对七国集团非工作时间声明发表评论的请求。

The G7 - the United States, Japan, Germany, Britain, France, Italy and Canada - expressed "concern" over recent control measures on the export of critical minerals.翻译:七国集团——美国、日本、德国、英国、法国、意大利和加拿大——对最近关键矿产出口控制措施表示“担忧”。

China, the world's top graphite producer, this month announced export curbs on the key material, used in electric vehicle batteries, in another bid to control critical mineral supply in response to challenges over its global manufacturing dominance.翻译:全球最大的石墨生产国中国本月宣布对用于电动汽车电池的关键材料实施出口限制，这是控制关键矿物供应的又一举措，以应对其全球制造业主导地位面临的挑战。

The G7 ministers "shared the need, a genuinely strong one, to reduce dependence on a particular country" for the supply of critical resources, said Yasutoshi Nishimura, trade minister of the host Japan. "We completely agreed to build resilient and reliable supply chains" for critical minerals, semiconductors and batteries, he told a press conference.翻译:东道国日本贸易大臣西村康稔表示，七国集团部长们“一致认为，需要减少对特定国家供应关键资源的依赖，这是真正强烈的需要”。他在新闻发布会上表示，“我们完全同意为关键矿物、半导体和电池建立有弹性和可靠的供应链”。

The ministers reaffirmed their concerns on "a wide and evolving range of non-market policies" that include "pervasive, opaque and trade-distortive industrial subsidies" and forced technology transfer, the statement said.翻译:声明称，部长们重申了他们对“广泛且不断演变的非市场政策”的担忧，其中包括“普遍、不透明和扭曲贸易的工业补贴”和强制技术转让。

On Russia, the G7 officials condemned its destruction of Ukrainian grain export infrastructure in its invasion of the country, and Moscow's decision to "unilaterally" leave talks on an agreement that had allowed grain giant Ukraine to export wheat and other products through the Black Sea.翻译:关于俄罗斯，七国集团官员谴责俄罗斯入侵乌克兰时破坏了乌克兰粮食出口基础设施，并谴责莫斯科决定“单方面”退出一项允许粮食巨头乌克兰通过黑海出口小麦和其他产品的协议谈判。

Unlike the G7 finance ministers' meeting two weeks ago, which condemned "terror attacks" on Israel by Hamas, the trade ministers did not mention the Middle East crisis, saying only that they "seek to raise awareness about the challenges of moving humanitarian goods across international borders during natural disasters and other emergencies".翻译:与两周前谴责哈马斯对以色列的“恐怖袭击”的七国集团财长会议不同，贸易部长们没有提及中东危机，只是表示他们“寻求提高人们对运送人道主义物资所面临挑战的认识”。自然灾害和其他紧急情况期间的国际边界”。

Western countries have generally backed what they say is Israel's right to self-defence, but there has been mounting international concern over the toll from Israel's bombing and growing calls for a pause to allow aid to reach Palestinian civilians in Gaza.翻译:西方国家普遍支持他们所说的以色列的自卫权，但国际社会对以色列轰炸造成的人员伤亡越来越关注，并且越来越多的人呼吁暂停向加沙的巴勒斯坦平民提供援助。

Reporting by Kantaro Komiya; Additional reporting by Liz Lee in Beijing; Editing by William Mallard翻译:小宫贯太郎报道； Liz Lee 在北京的补充报道；威廉·马拉德编辑

item.title: 中国在国防部长缺席的情况下启动香山论坛
item.description:
Beijing Xiangshan Forum, China's biggest annual show of military diplomacy, started on Sunday, although the Asian power is still missing a defence minister, who typically hosts this event.翻译:中国最大的年度军事外交盛会——北京香山论坛于周日开幕，尽管这个亚洲强国仍然缺少通常主办这一活动的国防部长。

China hopes to use the forum to promote President Xi Jinping's vision for a safer world and draw developing countries closer, as it faces increased coordination between the United States and its allies to curtail its military ambitions.翻译:中国希望利用该论坛来宣传习近平主席关于建设更安全世界的愿景，并拉近发展中国家的距离，因为中国面临着美国与其盟友加强协调以遏制其军事野心的情况。

Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu was initially listed in the forum's agenda as the first guest speaker at Monday's opening ceremony, a sign that suggests China intends to give Russia, which invaded in Ukraine in 2022, centre stage at the forum. But as of Sunday, Shoigu’s name was not on the agenda.翻译:俄罗斯国防部长谢尔盖·绍伊古最初被列入论坛议程，成为周一开幕式的第一位演讲嘉宾，这一迹象表明，中国打算让2022年入侵乌克兰的俄罗斯成为论坛的中心舞台。但截至周日，绍伊古的名字并未出现在议程上。

The U.S. defence department has sent a delegation led by Xanthi Carras, China country director in the Office of the Undersecretary of Defense.翻译:美国国防部派出由国防部副部长办公室中国国家主任克桑西·卡拉斯率领的代表团。

This year's forum takes place at an awkward time for China, when it is without a defence minister, whose main role is to engage with foreign militaries.翻译:今年的论坛是在中国一个尴尬的时刻举行的，因为中国没有国防部长，而国防部长的主要职责是与外国军队接触。

On Tuesday, Beijing sacked defence minister Li Shangfu but did not name a replacement. Reuters reported last month that Li, who has been missing for two months, was being investigated for corruption.翻译:周二，北京解除了国防部长李尚福的职务，但没有任命继任者。路透社上个月报道称，失踪两个月的李正因腐败问题接受调查。

Chinese military leaders more senior than the defence minister have filled in for Li. State media reported that Zhang Youxia and He Weidong, ranked number two and three in the military, separately held bilateral meetings with the defence ministers from Laos, Mongolia and Vietnam on Saturday.翻译:比国防部长更高级的中国军方领导人已接替李的职务。官方媒体报道称，军中排名第二和第三的张又侠和何卫东周六分别与老挝、蒙古和越南国防部长举行了双边会晤。

Zhang is due to make a speech at a dinner reception on Sunday and also give the keynote address on Monday, a task performed by the defence minister in previous years.翻译:张计划于周日的晚宴上发表讲话，并于周一发表主旨演讲，这是往年由国防部长承担的任务。

State news agency Xinhua reported that the number and level of foreign participants, including 22 defence ministers and 14 military chiefs, are the highest this year since the forum was first held in 2006.翻译:据新华社报道，今年论坛的外国参会人数和级别是自2006年首次举办以来的最高水平，其中包括22名国防部长和14名军方领导人。

In particular, China is focusing its outreach to the Global South.翻译:特别是，中国正在重点向南半球国家拓展业务。

Zhao Yufei, an official with the event organiser, said the forum will call on developing countries to oppose bloc confrontation and a "Cold War mentality", which are two frequent criticisms Beijing have of the West.翻译:活动主办方官员赵宇飞表示，论坛将呼吁发展中国家反对集团对抗和“冷战思维”，这是北京经常批评西方的两个方面。

Two defence diplomats whose countries have sent ministers told Reuters the forum offers a rare opportunity to engage with senior Chinese defence officials and military leaders to build trust, which would be key in times of crisis.翻译:两名派出部长的国家的国防外交官告诉路透社，该论坛提供了与中国高级国防官员和军事领导人接触以建立信任的难得机会，这在危机时期至关重要。

Concerned about how open the forum can be, many in the West have either shunned it or are only sending small and low-level delegations, preferring instead to discuss international security issues at the Shangri-La Dialogue held annually in Singapore.翻译:由于担心该论坛的开放程度，许多西方国家要么回避它，要么只派出小规模、低级别的代表团，而宁愿在每年在新加坡举行的香格里拉对话上讨论国际安全问题。

Some European countries, including France, plan to send a small delegation from their defence ministries, according to sources familiar with the matter.翻译:据知情人士透露，包括法国在内的一些欧洲国家计划派遣其国防部长组成的小型代表团。

NATO's delegation will be led by Wendin Smith, its security policy director, a NATO official said.翻译:北约官员表示，北约代表团将由其安全政策主任温丁·史密斯率领。

Reporting by Yew Lun Tian and Laurie Chen, additional reporting by Philip Blenkinsop in Brussels翻译:Yew Lun Tian 和 Laurie Chen 的报道，Philip Blenkinsop 在布鲁塞尔的补充报道

item.title: 中国官方媒体报道中国党代表团访问所罗门群岛
item.description:
A Chinese communist party delegation has visited the Solomon Islands, calling the "flourishing" cooperation between China and the Pacific nation a show of how diplomatic ties were in their peoples' interest, Chinese state media said on Sunday.翻译:中国官方媒体周日称，中国共产党代表团访问了所罗门群岛，称中国与这个太平洋国家之间“蓬勃发展”的合作表明，外交关系符合两国人民的利益。

The delegation led by the deputy head of the international department under China's Communist Party central committee, Guo Yezhou, met Solomon Islands' Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare during a visit spanning Friday to Sunday. The delegation also met the foreign minister and energy minister.翻译:中共中央对外联络部副部长郭业洲率代表团于周五至周日访问所罗门群岛，会见了总理索加瓦雷。代表团还会见了外交部长和能源部长。

China had signed a policing pact with the Solomon Islands in July, as both countries upgraded their ties to a "comprehensive strategic partnership" when Sogavare met Chinese Premier Li Qiang in Beijing.翻译:今年7月，索加瓦雷在北京会见中国总理李强，中国与所罗门群岛签署了警务协议，两国将关系升级为“全面战略伙伴关系”。

China's visit to the southern Pacific archipelago comes a week before Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is set to visit Beijing.翻译:中国对南太平洋群岛的访问是在澳大利亚总理安东尼·阿尔巴内塞访问北京之前一周进行的。

In June, Sogavare called for a review of its security treaty with Australia, which has historically provided policing support to the Solomon Islands.翻译:六月，索加瓦雷呼吁审查与澳大利亚的安全条约，澳大利亚历来为所罗门群岛提供警务支持。

The Solomon Islands' security pact with China had also alarmed the United States, which responded saying it was committed to a strong relationship with the region and strengthening longstanding bonds with the people of the Solomon Islands.翻译:所罗门群岛与中国的安全协定也引起了美国的警惕，美国回应说，它致力于与该地区建立牢固的关系，并加强与所罗门群岛人民的长期联系。

item.title: 中国外长表示习拜登峰会之路不会一帆风顺
item.description:
China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said the "road to the San Francisco summit will not be a smooth one", the foreign ministry said on Sunday, in a reference to an expected meeting between President Xi Jinping and U.S. President Joe Biden.翻译:中国外交部周日表示，中国外交部长王毅在提到习近平主席和美国总统拜登预计举行的会晤时表示，“通往旧金山峰会的道路不会一帆风顺”。

Wang met Biden and his top aides in Washington in recent days, agreeing to work together toward the expected bilateral meeting on the sidelines of an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum summit.翻译:王最近几天在华盛顿会见了拜登及其高级助手，同意共同努力，推动亚太经济合作论坛峰会期间举行的双边会晤。

A flurry of bilateral diplomatic engagements in recent months, largely at U.S. request, has aimed at salvaging what were rapidly deteriorating ties early in the year following the U.S. downing of an alleged Chinese spy balloon.翻译:近几个月来，主要是应美国要求，一系列双边外交接触旨在挽救年初美国击落所谓的中国间谍气球后迅速恶化的关系。

But in remarks on Saturday, Wang cautioned the road to the summit would not be a smooth one and travelling there would not be on "autopilot", the ministry said in a statement.翻译:但外交部在一份声明中表示，王在周六的讲话中警告说，通往峰会的道路不会一帆风顺，前往那里的旅行也不会“自动驾驶”。

He was speaking after a discussion with members of the U.S. strategic community in Washington, the ministry said.翻译:该部表示，他是在华盛顿与美国战略界成员讨论后发表上述言论的。

Last month, China's top security agency suggested any Xi-Biden meeting in San Francisco hinged on the U.S. "showing sufficient sincerity".翻译:上个月，中国最高安全机构表示，习拜登在旧金山举行的任何会晤都取决于美国“表现出足够的诚意”。

Wang said China and the U.S. needed to "return to Bali", referring to the last meeting between Biden and Xi, on the sidelines of a Group of 20 summit on the Indonesian resort island last November, where they discussed Taiwan, competition and communication.翻译:王说，中国和美国需要“回到巴厘岛”，指的是拜登和习近平去年11月在印度尼西亚度假岛屿举行的20国集团峰会间隙举行的最后一次会面，当时他们讨论了台湾、竞争和沟通问题。

Washington and Beijing must put into practice the consensus achieved then, "remove interference, overcome obstacles, enhance consensus and gather outcomes", Wang said.翻译:华盛顿和北京必须将双方达成的共识落到实处，“排除干扰，克服障碍，凝聚共识，凝聚成果”。

He said both sides have jointly sent out positive signals to stabilise and improve relations, believing it is useful and necessary to maintain dialogue even as there are still various differences and contradictions, and issues to be resolved.翻译:他表示，双方共同发出了稳定和改善关系的积极信号，认为在仍存在各种分歧矛盾和问题有待解决的情况下，保持对话是有益的、必要的。

Saturday's discussions also included in-depth exchanges on the interaction between China and U.S. militaries, finance, science and technology, China's investment environment and market access, as well as the Middle East and Ukraine crises.翻译:周六的讨论还包括就中美两军互动、金融科技、中国投资环境和市场准入以及中东和乌克兰危机等问题进行了深入交流。

Reporting by Liz Lee; Editing by William Mallard翻译:丽兹·李报道；威廉·马拉德编辑

item.title: 中国航班量将比疫情前水平增加 34%
item.description:
China's aviation regulator said it will increase domestic flights to 34% above pre-pandemic levels, a move that will further boost the recovery of Chinese airlines.翻译:中国航空监管机构表示，将把国内航班数量增加至疫情前水平的34%，此举将进一步推动中国航空公司的复苏。

China's top airlines reported their first quarterly profits in more than three years on Friday, fanning industry hopes for China's big three state carriers to finally step out of the difficulties brought by the COVID-19 pandemic.翻译:周五，中国顶级航空公司公布了三年多来的首个季度利润，引发业界对中国三大国有航空公司最终摆脱 COVID-19 大流行带来的困难的希望。

The Civil Aviation Administration of China will roll out its winter and spring season flight plan on Sunday, which will last until March 30, according to the summary of a Friday press conference on the website of CAAC News, which is run by the aviation regulator.翻译:据航空监管机构主办的中国民航新闻网周五举行的新闻发布会摘要显示，中国民航局将于周日推出冬春季节航班计划，该计划将持续至3月30日。

There will be 96,651 domestic flights a week, or 34% higher than the same period four years ago, with 7,202 new weekly flights brought on by the opening of 516 new domestic routes.翻译:每周国内航班96,651架次，比四年前同期增长34%，新增国内航线516条，每周新增航班7,202架次。

The increase in domestic flights focuses on connections between regional and hub airports like Shanghai, Beijing and Guangzhou, the regulator said.翻译:监管机构表示，国内航班的增加主要集中在上海、北京和广州等支线机场和枢纽机场之间的航线。

International flights, while slower to recover, are also picking up steam. In the next five months there will be 16,680 weekly flights, with passenger flights expected to reach 71% of the total four years ago.翻译:国际航班虽然恢复较慢，但也在加速增长。未来五个月每周航班数量将达到16,680架次，客运航班数量预计将达到四年前总数的71%。

Flights to and from 22 countries, including Britain and Italy, have neared or overtaken pre-pandemic levels, the regulator said.翻译:监管机构表示，往返于英国和意大利等 22 个国家的航班已接近或超过大流行前的水平。

In the winter and spring season, weekly direct passenger flights between China and the United States are expected to increase to 70 from 48, according to a post on Sunday on the CAAC News WeChat account.翻译:据民航新闻微信公众号周日发布的消息称，冬春季节，中美之间每周直飞客运航班预计将从48个增至70个。

item.title: 韩国和美军举行无人机、激光传感器演习
item.description:
South Korean and U.S. troops held joint future combat drills involving drones, an unmanned vehicle and wearable laser sensors this week as part of efforts to modernise their militaries, Seoul's army said on Saturday.翻译:首尔陆军周六表示，韩国和美国军队本周举行了涉及无人机、无人驾驶车辆和可穿戴激光传感器的联合未来作战演习，作为两国军队现代化努力的一部分。

The training came as South Korea's military conducts a series of annual Hoguk autumn exercises aimed at improving responses to North Korea's nuclear and missile threats.翻译:此次训练正值韩国军方举行一系列年度“护国”秋季演习，旨在改善对朝鲜核威胁和导弹威胁的反应。

More than 120 soldiers from both sides joined forces to fight against a trained team of opposing forces in a mock-up town that appeared similar to the North Korean capital of Pyongyang, built at the Korea Combat Training Centre in the mountains in the eastern city of Inje.翻译:双方 120 多名士兵联手，在一座模拟城镇中与一支训练有素的敌方部队作战，该城镇看起来与朝鲜首都平壤相似，该城镇建于朝鲜东部城市山区的韩国战斗训练中心。注射。

The drills also mobilised various high-tech weapons systems aimed at beefing up future combat capabilities, with the troops wearing multiple integrated laser engagement systems (MILES), which uses lasers to simulate actual battle.翻译:演习还动用了旨在增强未来作战能力的各种高科技武器系统，部队佩戴了多种综合激光交战系统（MILES），利用激光模拟实际战斗。

Several drones were flown for reconnaissance purposes, some also firing an assault rifle, while South Korea dispatched a multipurpose unmanned vehicle to carry wounded personnel.翻译:多架无人机用于侦察目的，有些还发射突击步枪，韩国则派出一辆多用途无人机运载伤员。

Choi Jeong-Il, a captain of the South Korean army's 25th Infantry Division, nicknamed the TIGER brigade, said the unmanned assets and the MILES gear helped identify enemies and gauge the allied troops' casualties.翻译:韩国陆军第 25 步兵师（绰号为 TIGER 旅）的队长 Choi Jeong-Il 表示，无人机和 MILES 装备有助于识别敌人并评估盟军的伤亡情况。

"We were able to confirm the enemy's movements using the drones, and hit them with the cutting-edge strike equipment, which allowed us to maximise the results of the operation while minimising damage to our forces," he said.翻译:他说：“我们能够使用无人机确认敌人的动向，并用尖端打击设备打击他们，这使我们能够最大限度地提高行动效果，同时最大限度地减少对我方部队的损害。”

First Lieutenant Derek Chen from the 2nd Stryker Brigade Combat Team of the U.S. 4th Infantry Division said the drills offered an "eye-opening experience" and the assets would be beneficial in future combat operations.翻译:美国第4步兵师第2史赛克旅战斗队的德里克·陈中尉表示，这次演习提供了“令人大开眼界的经历”，这些资产将有利于未来的作战行动。

South Korea's army launched the TIGER brigade last year as a pilot unit for future warfare operations using artificial intelligence-powered drones and highly mobile fighting vehicles. It aims to transform all combat units based on that model by 2040.翻译:韩国陆军去年成立了“老虎”旅，作为未来战争行动的试点单位，使用人工智能驱动的无人机和高度机动的战车。它的目标是到2040年将所有作战单位改造为基于该模型。

The army also held what it called its first international future warfare competition for five days until Saturday, participated by some 300 troops from five countries including Britain, Uzbekistan and Cambodia.翻译:截至周六，陆军还举行了为期五天的首次国际未来战争竞赛，来自英国、乌兹别克斯坦和柬埔寨等五个国家的约300名士兵参加了比赛。

Reporting by Hyonhee Shin and Daewoung Kim; Editing by Raju Gopalakrishnan翻译:Hyonhee Shin 和 Daewoung Kim 报道；编辑：拉朱·戈帕拉克里希南

item.title: 美中同意为预期的拜登-习近平峰会而努力
item.description:
The U.S. and China have agreed to work together toward an expected summit between presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping next month, U.S. officials said on Friday, following hours of meetings between Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi and senior U.S. diplomats in Washington.翻译:在中国外交部长王毅与美国高级外交官在华盛顿进行了数小时的会晤后，美国官员周五表示，美国和中国已同意共同努力，推动拜登总统和习近平总统下个月举行峰会。

In the first visit by a Chinese foreign minister to Washington since 2018, veteran diplomat Wang Yi also met Biden for an hour, talks that the White House described as a "good opportunity" in keeping lines of communication open between the two geopolitical rivals with deep policy differences.翻译:这是中国外长自 2018 年以来首次访问华盛顿，资深外交官王毅也与拜登进行了一个小时的会面，白宫称这次会谈是保持两个地缘政治对手之间沟通渠道畅通的“好机会”。政策差异。

Wang's meetings with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and U.S. national security advisor Jake Sullivan spanning over two days totaled nine hours, U.S. officials said, describing these interactions as "candid and in-depth".翻译:美国官员表示，王毅与美国国务卿布林肯和国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文的会面历时两天，总计九个小时，并称这些互动“坦诚而深入”。

Biden's top aides raised Washington's key concerns: the need to restore military-to-military channels between the two countries, Beijing's actions in the East and South China Sea, Taiwan, human rights, the flow of fentanyl precursors and the cases of Americans detained in China, U.S. officials said.翻译:拜登的高级助手提出了华盛顿的主要关切：恢复两国之间军事渠道的必要性、北京在东海和南海的行动、台湾、人权、芬太尼前体的流动以及在美国被拘留的美国人案件。美国官员称，中国。

There were also "frank exchanges" between Blinken and Wang over the erupting conflict in the Middle East.翻译:布林肯和王之间还就中东爆发的冲突进行了“坦诚的交流”。

The key area that appeared to show some positive momentum was toward an expected meeting between Biden and Xi on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit next month in San Francisco.翻译:似乎显示出一些积极势头的关键领域是拜登和习近平预计将于下个月在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会期间举行会晤。

"We are making preparations for such a meeting," said one of the senior administration officials briefing reporters on condition of anonymity. "Obviously, Chinese leaders often confirm publicly much closer to a trip, so I will leave it to the Chinese side to figure out if and when they make that announcement," the official said.翻译:一位不愿透露姓名的高级政府官员向记者介绍说：“我们正在为这样的会议做准备。”这位官员表示：“显然，中国领导人经常会公开确认即将进行的访问，因此我将让中方决定是否以及何时宣布这一消息。”

Wang told Biden that the objective of his visit was to help "stem the decline" in U.S.-China ties "with an eye on San Francisco", without giving any details, according to a brief statement from the Chinese foreign ministry.翻译:根据中国外交部的一份简短声明，王告诉拜登，他此行的目的是“着眼于旧金山”，帮助“遏制”美中关系的下滑，但没有透露任何细节。

The foreign ministry readouts for Wang's meetings with Blinken and Sullivan said that "both sides agreed to work together to achieve a meeting between the two heads of state in San Francisco."翻译:外交部通报王毅与布林肯和沙利文会晤的消息称，“双方同意共同努力，促成两国元首在旧金山举行会晤”。

"China attaches importance to the U.S. side's hopes of stabilizing and improving U.S. ties with China," Wang was quoted as saying in his meeting with Biden.翻译:王毅在会见拜登时表示，中方重视美方稳定和改善美中关系的愿望。

The Biden administration has seen direct leader-level engagement with Xi as particularly important in managing tensions as it seeks to prevent relations from veering into conflict.翻译:拜登政府认为，与习近平的领导人直接接触对于管理紧张局势尤为重要，因为它试图防止关系陷入冲突。

"A big part of a potential meeting would be the two leaders sitting down together and having those conversations on strategic intent," the U.S. official said.翻译:这位美国官员表示：“潜在会议的一个重要部分将是两位领导人坐在一起，就战略意图进行对话。”

On Thursday, Wang told Blinken that the two countries have disagreements and need "in-depth" and "comprehensive" dialogue to reduce misunderstandings and stabilize ties. "Not only should we resume dialogue, the dialogue should be in-depth and comprehensive," Wang said.翻译:周四，王告诉布林肯，两国存在分歧，需要“深入”和“全面”对话，以减少误解并稳定关系。王说：“我们不仅应该恢复对话，而且对话应该深入、全面。”

Wang's three-day visit follows a flurry of bilateral diplomatic engagements in recent months, largely at U.S. request, aimed at salvaging what were rapidly deteriorating ties early in the year following the U.S. downing of an alleged Chinese spy balloon.翻译:在王毅为期三天的访问之前，近几个月主要应美国要求进行了一系列双边外交接触，旨在挽救年初美国击落所谓的中国间谍气球后迅速恶化的两国关系。

But some in Washington have questioned whether a slate of mostly unreciprocated U.S. cabinet-level official visits to Beijing over the past six months, including by Blinken, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, played into Beijing's hand.翻译:但华盛顿的一些人质疑，过去六个月美国内阁级官员对北京进行的一系列几乎没有回应的正式访问，包括布林肯、财政部长珍妮特·耶伦和商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多，是否对北京有利。

The trips by Yellen and Raimondo led to new bilateral economic and commercial working groups, which critics worry will only pull U.S. focus away from - and possibly delay - sanctions, export controls and broader measures intended to enhance U.S. competition with China.翻译:耶伦和雷蒙多的出访促成了新的双边经济和商业工作组的成立，批评人士担心，这只会将美国的注意力从制裁、出口管制和旨在加强美国与中国竞争的更广泛措施上转移，甚至可能推迟。

U.S. officials have maintained that increased diplomacy does not mean a let up in policy.翻译:美国官员坚称，加强外交并不意味着放松政策。

CONCERN OVER MIDDLE EAST

The Israel-Hamas conflict has added a fresh dynamic to the testy relationship between the superpowers, and Washington is hoping Beijing can use its influence with Iran to prevent an escalation into a wider war in the Middle East.翻译:以色列与哈马斯的冲突给超级大国之间紧张的关系增添了新的动力，华盛顿希望北京能够利用其对伊朗的影响力，防止中东地区的战争升级为更广泛的战争。

U.S. officials said the issue came up frequently during Wang's meetings but it was unclear whether Washington was able to get Beijing on board to commit to using its influence to help contain the conflict.翻译:美国官员表示，这个问题在王毅的会议上经常被提及，但目前尚不清楚华盛顿是否能够让北京方面承诺利用其影响力帮助遏制冲突。

"We expressed our deep concern with the situation and pressed China to take a more constructive approach, and that would include, of course, their engagements with the Iranians, to urge calm," another of the senior administration officials said.翻译:另一位政府高级官员表示：“我们对局势表示深切关注，并敦促中国采取更具建设性的做法，其中当然包括与伊朗人接触，以敦促各方保持冷静。”

China has condemned violence and attacks on civilians in the conflict, and while Wang has declared Israel's actions "beyond the scope of self-defense" he has not named Hamas in his comments.翻译:中国谴责冲突中针对平民的暴力和袭击，虽然王宣称以色列的行动“超出自卫范围”，但他在评论中没有点名哈马斯。

The second official said Blinken raised U.S. concerns about China’s recent actions in the South China Sea and the East China Sea, including its “dangerous and unlawful obstruction” of the Philippine resupply mission to Second Thomas Shoal in the South China Sea and its unsafe intercept of a U.S. aircraft.翻译:第二名官员表示，布林肯提出了美国对中国最近在南海和东海的行动的担忧，包括“危险且非法地阻碍”菲律宾在南海仁爱礁的补给任务，以及不安全拦截菲律宾的补给任务。一架美国飞机。

item.title: 被习近平边缘化的中国前总理李克强去世，享年 68 岁
item.description:
Chinese former Premier Li Keqiang died of a heart attack on Friday, barely seven months after retiring from a decade in office during which his reformist star had dimmed. He was 68.翻译:中国前总理李克强周五因心脏病去世，距他卸任仅七个月，他的改革派明星在十年任期内黯淡下来。他 68 岁了。

Once viewed as a top Communist Party leadership contender, Li was sidelined in recent years by President Xi Jinping, who tightened his grip on power and steered the world's second-largest economy in a more statist direction.翻译:李克强一度被视为共产党领导层的最高竞争者，但近年来却被国家主席习近平排挤，习近平加强了对权力的控制，并引导世界第二大经济体走向更加集权的方向。

The elite economist Li had supported a more open market economy, advocating supply-side reforms in an approach dubbed "Likonomics" that was never fully implemented.翻译:精英经济学家李克强支持更加开放的市场经济，提倡供给侧改革，这种改革被称为“李康经济学”，但从未得到充分实施。

Ultimately, he had to bend to Xi's preference for more state control, and his former power base waned in influence as Xi installed his own acolytes to powerful positions.翻译:最终，他不得不屈服于习近平对更多国家控制的偏好，而随着习近平将自己的追随者安插到权力职位上，他以前的权力基础的影响力逐渐减弱。

"Comrade Li Keqiang, while resting in Shanghai in recent days, experienced a sudden heart attack on Oct. 26 and after all-out efforts to revive him failed, died in Shanghai at ten minutes past midnight on Oct. 27," state broadcaster CCTV reported.翻译:“李克强同志近日在上海休养期间，10月26日突发心脏病，经全力抢救无效，于10月27日午夜10分在上海逝世”，中央电视台报道称。

An official obituary published by state media Xinhua on Friday called his death a "huge loss to the party and nation", describing him as an "outstanding leader".翻译:官方媒体新华社周五发布的官方讣告称他的去世是“党和国家的巨大损失”，称他为“杰出领导人”。

"We must turn our grief into strength, learn from his revolutionary spirit, noble character and fine style," Xinhua said.翻译:新华社说：“我们一定要化悲痛为力量，学习他的革命精神、高尚品格和优良作风。”

The obituary listed his policy achievements and said four times that Li carried out his work under the "strong leadership" of Xi.翻译:讣告列出了他的政策成就，并四次称李克强是在习近平的“坚强领导”下开展工作的。

There was an outpouring of grief and shock on Chinese social media, with some government websites going black-and-white in an official sign of mourning. The Weibo microblogging platform turned its "like" button into a "mourn" icon in the shape of a chrysanthemum on its mobile app.翻译:中国社交媒体上充斥着悲伤和震惊，一些政府网站变成黑白的，以示官方哀悼。微博微博平台将其移动应用程序上的“点赞”按钮变成了菊花形状的“哀悼”图标。

"He's only 68. He probably hasn't enjoyed his life yet, right? He's been busy all the time taking care of the country’s important responsibilities," said a 74-year-old Shanghai retiree surnamed Xu. "We're all very sad."翻译:“他才68岁，应该还没有享受过生活吧？一直忙着承担国家的重任。”74岁的上海退休人员徐先生说。 “我们都很伤心。”

Li was premier and head of China's cabinet under Xi for a decade until stepping down from all political positions in March.翻译:李克强在习近平领导下担任总理和中国国务院总理十年，直到今年三月辞去所有政治职务。

Laying a wreath in August 2022 at a statue of Deng Xiaoping - the leader who brought transformational reform to China's economy - Li vowed: "Reform and opening up will not stop. The Yangtze and Yellow River will not reverse course."翻译:2022年8月，李克强向给中国经济带来转型改革的领导人邓小平雕像敬献花圈，并发誓：“改革开放不会停止，长江黄河不会逆转。”

Video clips of the speech, which went viral but were later censored from Chinese social media, were widely viewed as a coded criticism of Xi's policies.翻译:演讲的视频片段在网上疯传，但后来在中国社交媒体上遭到审查，被广泛视为对习近平政策的暗中批评。

Li also sparked debate on poverty and income inequality in 2020 when he said that 600 million people in the increasingly rich nation earned less than $140 per month.翻译:李还引发了关于 2020 年贫困和收入不平等的争论，他表示，在这个日益富裕的国家，有 6 亿人的月收入不足 140 美元。

END OF AN ERA

Some Chinese intellectuals and members of the liberal elite expressed shock and dismay on a semi-private WeChat channel at the passing of a beacon of liberal economic reform, with some saying it signalled the end of an era.翻译:一些中国知识分子和自由派精英成员在半私人微信频道上对自由主义经济改革灯塔的逝去表示震惊和沮丧，有人说这标志着一个时代的结束。

"Li will probably be remembered as an advocate for the freer market and for the have-nots," said Wen-Ti Sung, a political scientist at Australian National University. "But most of all, he will be remembered for what could have been."翻译:澳大利亚国立大学政治学家宋文迪表示：“李克强可能会作为自由市场和穷人的倡导者而被铭记。” “但最重要的是，人们会记住他本来可以做的事情。”

Alfred Wu, associate professor at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy in Singapore, said: "All these types of people no longer exist anymore in Chinese politics."翻译:新加坡李光耀公共政策学院副教授吴阿尔弗雷德表示：“所有这些类型的人在中国政治中已经不复存在了。”

Li was less influential than his immediate predecessors as premier, Zhu Rongji and Wen Jiabao, Wu said. "He was sidelined, but what more could he have done? It was very hard for him, with the constraints he faced under Xi."翻译:吴说，李克强的影响力不如他的前任总理朱镕基和温家宝。 “他被边缘化了，但他还能做什么呢？这对他来说非常困难，因为他在习近平的领导下面临着限制。”

Adam Ni, an independent China political analyst, described Li as "a premier who stood powerless as China took a sharp turn away from reform and opening".翻译:独立中国政治分析家倪亚当将李描述为“当中国急剧偏离改革开放时却无能为力的总理”。

A glowing 2014 state media profile of Li, praising him as "a calm and tough wall-breaker", went viral shortly after his death was announced. It emphasised his hard work and tenacity in pushing for economic reforms.翻译:2014年，官方媒体对李嘉诚的一篇热情洋溢的简介称赞他是“一位冷静而坚韧的破壁者”，在他去世的消息公布后不久就在网上疯传。它强调了他在推动经济改革方面的努力和坚韧。

Li's frequent visits to disaster sites and his easy camaraderie when speaking to ordinary people were also highlighted on Chinese state media.翻译:中国官方媒体也强调了李克强经常访问灾区以及他与普通民众交谈时的轻松友情。

Some social media users mentioned a song called "Sorry it wasn't you", in another veiled reference to Xi. The song went viral around the death of former President Jiang Zemin in November last year before being censored.翻译:一些社交媒体用户提到了一首名为《对不起，不是你》的歌曲，这是另一首暗指习近平的歌曲。去年11月，前国家主席江泽民去世后，这首歌在网上疯传，随后遭到审查。

REFORMIST FACTION WANED

Retired Chinese leaders typically keep a low profile. Li was last seen in public during an August private tour of the Mogao Grottoes, a tourist attraction in northwest China. Social media videos showed him in good spirits, walking up stairs unaided and waving to excited crowds. Reuters could not independently verify the footage.翻译:退休的中国领导人通常保持低调。李最后一次在公开场合露面是在八月份一次私人游览中国西北部旅游胜地莫高窟时。社交媒体视频显示，他精神抖擞，独自走上楼梯，并向兴奋的人群挥手致意。路透社无法独立核实这段视频。

Li was born in Anhui province in eastern China, a poor farming area where his father was an official and where he was sent to work in the fields during the Cultural Revolution.翻译:李出生于中国东部的安徽省，这是一个贫困的农业地区，他的父亲是一名官员，文化大革命期间他被下放到田里干活。

While studying law at the prestigious Peking University, Li befriended ardent pro-democracy advocates, some of whom would become outright challengers to party control.翻译:在著名的北京大学学习法律期间，李结识了热心的民主倡导者，其中一些人后来成为党控制的彻底挑战者。

The confident English speaker was immersed in the intellectual and political ferment of the decade of reform under Deng. That period ended in the 1989 pro-democracy Tiananmen Square protests that the military crushed.翻译:这位自信的英语使用者沉浸在邓小平领导下十年改革的思想和政治骚动中。 1989 年天安门广场的民主抗议活动被军方镇压，这一时期就此结束。

After graduation, Li joined the Communist Party's Youth League, then a reformist-tinged ladder to higher office.翻译:毕业后，李加入了共产党的青年团，随后加入了带有改良主义色彩的升职阶梯。

He rose in the Youth League while completing a master’s degree in law and then an economics doctorate under Professor Li Yining, a well-known advocate of market reforms.翻译:他在共青团中崛起，并在著名的市场改革倡导者厉以宁教授的指导下获得了法学硕士学位和经济学博士学位。

Before entering elite politics in Beijing he served as the provincial party chief in Henan, a poor region in central China, and the rustbelt province of Liaoning bordering North Korea.翻译:在进入北京的精英政坛之前，他曾担任河南省（中国中部的贫困地区）和与朝鲜接壤的铁锈地带辽宁省的省委书记。

His patron was Hu Jintao, a former president from a political faction loosely based around the Youth League. After Xi took over as party chief in 2012, he took steps to break up the faction.翻译:他的赞助人是前国家主席胡锦涛，他来自一个松散地以共青团为基础的政治派别。习近平2012年接任党总书记后，采取措施瓦解该派系。

Li is survived by his wife Cheng Hong, a professor of English, and their daughter.翻译:李身后留下了他的妻子程虹（英语教授）和他们的女儿。

Reporting by Laurie Chen and Yew Lun Tian; Additional reporting by Nicoco Chan in Shanghai and Liz Lee in Beijing; Editing by William Mallard and Hugh Lawson翻译:Laurie Chen 和 Yew Lun Tian 的报道； Nicoco Chan 在上海和 Liz Lee 在北京的补充报道；威廉·马拉德和休·劳森编辑

item.title: 全球电动汽车电池供应链因中国石墨限制而困惑
item.description:
Beijing's move to restrict graphite exports will have a disproportionate impact on foreign makers of electric vehicle battery components who have not yet shifted to using as much synthetic material as Chinese counterparts, industry insiders and experts said.翻译:业内人士和专家表示，北京限制石墨出口的举措将对外国电动汽车电池零部件制造商产生不成比例的影响，这些制造商尚未像中国同行那样转向使用尽可能多的合成材料。

China's latest limit on critical mineral exports, which Beijing said is not targeted at a specific sector, has fuelled uncertainty in the global EV supply chain since it was announced last Friday.翻译:中国对关键矿产出口的最新限制自上周五宣布以来，加剧了全球电动汽车供应链的不确定性。北京方面表示，这一限制并非针对特定行业。

Some Chinese manufacturers, including those with operations overseas, said they expect limited impact from the rules as most EV batteries they make use a grade of synthetic material that is unaffected by the curbs.翻译:一些中国制造商，包括那些在海外开展业务的制造商表示，他们预计这些规定的影响有限，因为他们生产的大多数电动汽车电池都使用不受限制影响的合成材料。

China dominates the global EV battery supply chain including production of graphite - the single largest component. Graphite companies in the country process both the natural material mined domestically and overseas, as well as synthetic forms.翻译:中国在全球电动汽车电池供应链中占据主导地位，其中包括最大的单一零部件石墨的生产。该国的石墨公司加工国内外开采的天然材料以及合成材料。

Japan, South Korea and the United States are top buyers of both natural and synthetic Chinese graphite, and analysts warned the new measures could slow or reduce graphite supplies needed by companies there to produce anodes - the negative electrodes of EV batteries.翻译:日本、韩国和美国是中国天然和合成石墨的最大买家，分析师警告称，新措施可能会减缓或减少这些公司生产阳极（电动汽车电池的负极）所需的石墨供应。

Under the new rules, China will require export permits starting Dec. 1 for high-end synthetic graphite, as well as key forms of natural graphite.翻译:根据新规定，中国将从 12 月 1 日起要求高端合成石墨以及主要形式的天然石墨获得出口许可证。

Several executives in China and globally at companies that use graphite said they were still seeking further clarity on the new measures.翻译:中国和全球使用石墨的公司的几位高管表示，他们仍在寻求新措施的进一步明确性。

An employee at Qingdao Haida, a major Chinese graphite processor, who declined to be named as they was not authorised to speak on behalf of the company, told Reuters that the company's products include spherical graphite, which is used in lithium ion battery anodes and is covered by the new rules and is exported to South Korea and Japan.翻译:中国主要石墨加工商青岛海达的一名员工（因无权代表该公司发言而拒绝透露姓名）告诉路透社，该公司的产品包括球形石墨，用于锂离子电池阳极，符合新规定，出口韩国、日本。

"We haven't got any instructions from MOFCOM (China's Ministry of Commerce) on how to apply for export permits but it will definitely make the exporting process more inconvenient," the person said.翻译:该人士表示：“我们还没有收到中国商务部关于如何申请出口许可证的任何指示，但这肯定会让出口过程变得更加不方便。”

Haida did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:海达没有立即回应置评请求。

China's recent move to require export permits for gallium and germanium products has choked off international shipments of the chipmaking metals.翻译:中国最近要求镓和锗产品获得出口许可证，这阻碍了芯片制造金属的国际运输。

The commerce ministry did not respond to further queries from Reuters. A source familiar with the Chinese government's thinking noted that graphite was also used in military equipment.翻译:商务部没有回应路透社的进一步询问。一位熟悉中国政府想法的消息人士指出，石墨也用于军事装备。

CHINA'S SYNTHETIC PUSH

But Chinese companies, which have been building overseas plants, said the restrictions will have little effect on their operations abroad. The Chinese firms use synthetic graphite, but not the high grade form covered under the new measures, with a density of 1.73 grams per cubic centimetre and above.翻译:但一直在海外建设工厂的中国企业表示，这些限制对其海外业务影响不大。中国公司使用的是人造石墨，但不是新措施所涵盖的高品级石墨，其密度为每立方厘米1.73克及以上。

China produces large quantities of synthetic graphite, which enables lower battery charge times.翻译:中国生产大量人造石墨，可以缩短电池充电时间。

While adoption among foreign manufacturers is growing, their shift from natural to synthetic graphite has been slower, in part because it is more polluting to produce petroleum-based synthetic graphite and natural graphite anodes also tend to be cheaper, which makes them vulnerable to the Chinese curbs.翻译:虽然外国制造商的采用率正在增长，但他们从天然石墨向合成石墨的转变速度较慢，部分原因是生产石油基合成石墨的污染更大，而且天然石墨阳极往往更便宜，这使得它们很容易受到中国市场的影响。限制。

Volkswagen-backed Chinese firm Gotion High Tech (002074.SZ), which produces batteries in Germany and plans a U.S. plant, said graphite used in its batteries has a density lower than 1.7 grams per cubic centimetre, which would make it unaffected by the restrictions.翻译:大众汽车支持的中国公司国轩高科（002074.SZ）在德国生产电池，并计划在美国建厂，该公司表示，其电池中使用的石墨密度低于每立方厘米1.7克，这将使其不受限制的影响。

Similarly, BTR New Material Technology (835185.BJE), the world's largest anode producer, told Shanghai government-run media outlet The Paper that the rule's impact on it would be limited, as its products have a density of between 1.5 and 1.7 gram per cubic centimetre for EV batteries.翻译:同样，全球最大的阳极生产商贝特瑞新材料科技有限公司（835185.BJE）向上海官媒澎湃新闻表示，该规定对其影响有限，因为其产品的密度在1.5至1.7克/粒之间。立方厘米电动汽车电池。

Ningbo Shanshan (600884.SS), another leading Chinese anode maker, told The Paper that the restrictions would have no impact on its exports of artificial graphite products.翻译:中国另一家领先的负极制造商宁波杉杉（600884.SS）告诉澎湃新闻，这些限制不会对其人造石墨产品的出口产生影响。

BTR and Shanshan, which have announced plans to build factories in Indonesia and Finland, respectively, did not immediately respond to requests for comment from Reuters.翻译:贝特瑞和杉杉已分别宣布计划在印度尼西亚和芬兰建厂，但没有立即回应路透社的置评请求。

NATURAL GRAPHITE HIT

Global companies using natural graphite include Hitachi Chemical, part of Japan's Resonac Holdings Corp (4004.T), South Korea's POSCO Future M (003670.KS) and Japan's Mitsubishi Chemical, which produces natural graphite at two plants in China, according to research firm CRU Group.翻译:据研究公司称，使用天然石墨的全球公司包括日本 Resonac Holdings Corp (4004.T)旗下的日立化学 (Hitachi Chemical)、韩国 POSCO Future M (003670.KS)和日本三菱化学 (Mitsubishi Chemical) 在中国的两家工厂生产天然石墨。克鲁集团。

A Resonac spokesperson said it did not see any impact for now and was watching the situation. He declined to comment on details of graphite procurement, but said there were various routes, depending on individual products.翻译:Resonac 发言人表示，目前没有看到任何影响，正在关注事态发展。他拒绝评论石墨采购的细节，但表示有多种路线，具体取决于个别产品。

Mitsubishi Chemical did not respond to a request for comment, and POSCO declined to comment.翻译:三菱化学没有回应置评请求，浦项制铁也拒绝置评。

Australia-based Tesla supplier Syrah Resources, which mines graphite in Mozambique and is building a plant to produce anodes in the U.S. state of Louisiana, said on Thursday it expects buyers outside of China to step up purchases of natural graphite ahead of the stricter controls taking effect.翻译:总部位于澳大利亚的特斯拉供应商 Syrah Resources 在莫桑比克开采石墨，并正在美国路易斯安那州建设一家生产阳极的工厂。该公司周四表示，预计中国以外的买家将在采取更严格的控制措施之前加大对天然石墨的采购力度。影响。

India's Epsilon Advanced Materials (EAM) said this week it plans to open a $650 million plant to make battery materials and components including synthetic graphite in the U.S. state of North Carolina, and is in talks with suppliers about sourcing raw materials including natural graphite.翻译:印度Epsilon Advanced Materials (EAM)本周表示，计划斥资6.5亿美元在美国北卡罗来纳州开设一家工厂，生产包括合成石墨在内的电池材料和组件，并正在与供应商就采购包括天然石墨在内的原材料进行谈判。

"We believe that limiting the amount of graphite exported from China - and likely the price increase for graphite that it will create - exacerbates the challenges (and) exemplifies the need to develop synthetic graphite for the U.S. locally," EAM CEO Sunit Kapur told Reuters.翻译:EAM 首席执行官苏尼特·卡普尔 (Sunit Kapur) 告诉路透社：“我们认为，限制从中国出口的石墨数量，以及由此可能导致的石墨价格上涨，会加剧挑战，并证明需要在美国本土开发合成石墨。” 。

Reporting by Zhang Yan, Siyi Liu and Brenda Goh; Additional reporting by Satoshi Sugiyama in Toyko, Heekyong Yang in Seoul，Paul Lienert in Detroit, and Jing Xu in Beijing Editing by Dominique Patton, Tony Munroe and David Evans翻译:张岩、刘思怡、Brenda Goh 报道； Satoshi Sugiyama 在东京、Heekyong Yang 在首尔、Paul Lienert 在底特律以及 Jing Xu 在北京的补充报道 编辑：Dominique Patton、Tony Munroe 和 David Evans

item.title: 中国前总理留下未竟的改革遗产
item.description:
When China's Communist Party released the names of its 205-person Central Committee a year ago, there was a glaring omission: Li Keqiang, the premier.翻译:一年前，当中国共产党公布其205名中央委员会成员名单时，有一个明显的遗漏：总理李克强。

The exclusion of Li, who died of a heart attack on Friday at the age of 68, seemed to confirm what many long assumed - that his brand of economic reform had been officially scrapped in favor of President Xi Jinping's state-led approach to the economy.翻译:李克强于周五因心脏病去世，享年 68 岁，他被排除在外似乎证实了许多人长期以来的假设——他的经济改革方案已被正式放弃，取而代之的是国家主席习近平的国家主导的经济方针。 。

Reform is once again on the minds of China's policy makers and analysts as it struggles to revive flagging consumer demand and fend off Japan-style economic stagnation.翻译:在努力重振疲软的消费需求并抵御日本式的经济停滞之际，改革再次成为中国政策制定者和分析人士关注的焦点。

But rather than push changes advocated by many economists, such as renewed urbanisation and more space for private enterprise, China under Xi has put more power in the hands of the state.翻译:但习近平领导下的中国并没有推动许多经济学家所倡导的变革，例如重新城镇化和为私营企业提供更多空间，而是将更多权力交到了国家手中。

"It’s not an exaggeration to say that an era is over – an era when reforms could be steadily pushed forward," said a government policy adviser who declined to be identified.翻译:“毫不夸张地说，一个可以稳步推进改革的时代已经结束，”一位不愿透露姓名的政府政策顾问表示。

Li retired in March after a decade as China's second most senior leader and an advocate for private business but his power had been limited after Xi made himself China's most powerful leader in decades and tightened control over the economy and society.翻译:李克强在担任中国第二高领导人和私营企业倡导者十年后于三月退休，但在习近平使自己成为中国几十年来最强大的领导人并加强对经济和社会的控制后，他的权力受到限制。

The English-speaking premier, who held a PhD in economics from the elite Peking University, focused on improving conditions for entrepreneurs, wooing foreign investors, cutting red tape and boosting incomes for the poor.翻译:这位拥有精英北京大学经济学博士学位的英语国家总理致力于改善企业家的条件、吸引外国投资者、减少繁文缛节和提高穷人的收入。

But ambitious market-based reforms Beijing unveiled in 2013 quickly ran into trouble, including a 2015 stock market crash following a botched currency reform. Under Xi's leadership, the world's second-largest economy gradually turned back to old policies that have added to China's debt pile and industrial overcapacity.翻译:但北京在 2013 年推出的雄心勃勃的市场化改革很快就遇到了麻烦，其中包括 2015 年因货币改革失败而引发的股市崩盘。在习近平的领导下，世界第二大经济体逐渐回归旧政策，这些政策加剧了中国的债务负担和工业产能过剩。

"The scope for Li's policymaking and implementation had became more subordinated under President Xi Jinping, who had unabashedly dominated in politics and policy making, relegating Li to playing second fiddle," said Dali Yang, a politics professor at University of Chicago.翻译:芝加哥大学政治学教授杨大利表示，“在习近平主席的领导下，李克强的决策和执行范围变得更加从属，习近平毫不掩饰地主导着政治和政策制定，使李克强沦为次要角色。”

ALLIES

China's economic miracle started in 1978 when Deng Xiaoping launched historic reforms, allowing more private enterprises and opening the economy to foreign investment.翻译:中国的经济奇迹始于1978年，当时邓小平发起了历史性改革，允许更多的私营企业发展并向外国投资开放经济。

Li was not the only pro-reform leader who ended up out of the picture. Former economic tsar Liu He, former banking regulator Guo Shuqing, and former central bank chief Yi Gang, have all left government.翻译:李并不是唯一一位最终被排除在外的支持改革的领导人。前经济沙皇刘鹤、前银监会郭树清、前央行行长易纲均已离开政府。

Xi has instead packed the government with his allies, mostly officials with limited international or financial experience.翻译:相反，习近平在政府中塞满了他的盟友，其中大多数是国际或金融经验有限的官员。

Beijing is unleashing a round of stimulus in a bid to shore up the economic recovery but economists warn China could be headed for a long-period of deflation and stagnant growth that fails to lift living standards for its 1.4 billion people.翻译:北京正在推出新一轮刺激措施以提振经济复苏，但经济学家警告称，中国可能会陷入长期通货紧缩和增长停滞，从而无法提高14亿人民的生活水平。

Some government advisers have been beating the drum for reforms, focusing on spurring urbanisation and household spending power, reducing reliance on investment and leveling the playing field between state-owned enterprises and private firms.翻译:一些政府顾问一直在大力推动改革，重点是刺激城市化和家庭消费能力，减少对投资的依赖，并在国有企业和私营企业之间创造公平的竞争环境。

A Communist Party plenum, expected in November and which has traditionally focused on reforms, could disappoint those awaiting big changes.翻译:预计将于 11 月召开的共产党全会历来侧重于改革，但可能会让那些等待重大变革的人失望。

"I don't expect any breakthroughs on reforms," said the government policy adviser.翻译:“我预计改革不会取得任何突破，”政府政策顾问表示。

item.title: 解释者：中国对庞大的炼油行业施加增长限制
item.description:
China has set a minimum size for new oil refineries and will ban small crude processors that claim to be chemicals or bitumen producers under a plan to limit total capacity at 1 billion metric tons, or 20 million barrels per day, by 2025.翻译:中国已经设定了新建炼油厂的最小规模，并将禁止声称是化学品或沥青生产商的小型原油加工商，计划到 2025 年将总产能限制在 10 亿吨（即每天 2000 万桶）。

Following are key details on China's steps, outlined this week, to rein in a refining industry that recently surpassed the United States to become the world's largest.翻译:以下是中国本周概述的控制炼油行业措施的关键细节，该行业最近超过美国成为世界上最大的炼油行业。

WHAT IS CHINA TRYING TO ACHIEVE?

The overall capacity cap, first unveiled in October 2021 as part of a plan to reach peak carbon emissions by 2030, is aimed at curbing excessive domestic refinery production and supply overhang to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.翻译:总体产能上限于2021年10月首次公布，作为到2030年达到碳排放峰值计划的一部分，旨在遏制国内炼油厂过度生产和供应过剩，以减少温室气体排放。

China has long sought - and sometimes struggled - to remove excess capacity in highly polluting heavy industrial sectors such as steel and cement.翻译:中国长期以来一直寻求——有时甚至是努力——消除钢铁和水泥等高污染重工业部门的过剩产能。

The think tank Sinocarbon says the refining and petrochemical sectors accounted for 8% of emissions in 2020.翻译:中碳智库称，2020年炼油和石化行业排放量占排放量的8%。

The cap will also help curb China's already high reliance on imported crude oil, which stood at 76% last year.翻译:这一上限还将有助于遏制中国对进口原油的高度依赖（去年该依赖度为 76%）。

HOW HAS CHINA'S REFINERY SECTOR GROWN?

Refining capacity in China increased last year to 920 million metric tons per year, or 18.4 million bpd.翻译:去年，中国的炼油能力增至每年 9.2 亿吨，即 1,840 万桶/日。

The industry's recent growth has been driven since 2019 by the creation of three large independent refiners - Zhejiang Petrochemical, Hengli Petrochemical and Shenghong Petrochemical - adding a combined 1.52 million bpd capacity that is highly integrated with petrochemicals making.翻译:自 2019 年以来，浙江石化、恒力石化和盛虹石化这三个大型独立炼油厂的成立推动了该行业近期的增长，合计新增产能 152 万桶/日，与石化产品生产高度一体化。

Together with dominant state refiner Sinopec and its rival PetroChina, as well as an army of about 60 smaller independent processors known as "teapots", the refining sector has ballooned into the world's largest, surpassing the United States last year.翻译:加上占主导地位的国有炼油企业中石化及其竞争对手中石油，以及由约 60 家被称为“茶壶”的小型独立加工商组成的大军，炼油行业已迅速发展成为全球最大的炼油行业，去年超过了美国。

That growth has resulted in a low refinery utilization rate of 73% in 2022, based on official output data, compared with more than 91% in the U.S., which means China has surplus capacity to allow for large volumes of refined fuel exports.翻译:根据官方产量数据，这种增长导致2022年炼油厂利用率低至73%，而美国则超过91%，这意味着中国拥有过剩产能，可以进行大量精炼燃料出口。

WHAT IS THE LIKELY IMPACT OF THE MEASURES?

The measures could force more closures of small, inefficient plants, which have already taken place in teapot hub Shandong province, where some 400,000-bpd worth of capacity was mothballed in 2020 and 2021 to make way for the new Yulong Petrochemical plant of a similar size.翻译:这些措施可能会迫使更多小型、效率低下的工厂关闭，茶壶中心山东省已经关闭了这些工厂，该省在 2020 年和 2021 年封存了约 40 万桶/日的产能，为类似规模的新玉龙石化工厂让路。

Others players are expected to look abroad for growth. Polyester fiber maker Tongku Group and Rongsheng Petrochemical are both exploring building new refineries in Southeast Asia.翻译:其他参与者预计将寻求海外增长。聚酯纤维制造商桐库集团和熔盛石化都在探索在东南亚建设新炼油厂。

Many teapots, meanwhile, have over the years quietly expanded processing capacity, invested in oil storage or moved up the product value chain to make energy transition chemicals.翻译:与此同时，许多茶壶多年来悄悄扩大了加工能力，投资于石油储存或提升产品价值链以生产能源转型化学品。

WILL CHINA ACHIEVE ITS GOALS?

Apart from increasing scrutiny in approving new plants, the government can wield the powerful tool of crude oil import quotas, to which all independent refiners are subjected.翻译:除了在批准新工厂时加强审查之外，政府还可以利用原油进口配额这一强大工具，所有独立炼油厂都必须遵守该配额。

In recent years, the cap has stood at an annual 243 million tons, or 4.86 million bpd and actual grants have run below that.翻译:近年来，上限一直保持在每年 2.43 亿吨，即每天 486 万桶，而实际拨款却低于该上限。

Thanks to rigid quota management and crackdowns on illegal quota trading, China has already managed to limit refinery operations to some extent.翻译:通过严格的配额管理和打击非法配额交易，中国已经在一定程度上限制了炼油厂的开工。

Meanwhile, the government also maintains tight control over refined fuel exports, allowing only state refiners and one independent major refiner, Zhejiang Petrochemical Corp, the right to export.翻译:与此同时，政府还对成品油出口保持严格控制，只允许国有炼油企业和一家独立的大型炼油企业浙江石化集团公司拥有出口权。

WHICH ARE CHINA'S BIGGEST REFINERS?

China has about 34 refineries of 200,000 bpd or more, with combined processing capacity of 480 million tons, or 9.6 million bpd, according to Sinopec.翻译:据中石化称，中国约有34家日产量20万桶或以上的炼油厂，综合加工能力达4.8亿吨，即日加工量960万桶。

Most of these plants are run by Sinopec , PetroChina and China National Offshore Oil Company. Together, the three state giants operate nearly 12 million bpd of processing capacity.翻译:这些工厂大部分由中石化、中石油和中国海洋石油总公司运营。这三大国有巨头合计拥有近 1200 万桶/日的加工能力。

HOW MUCH NEW CAPACITY IS IN THE PIPELINE?

Four new refineries with combined capacity of 1.2 million bpd are planned, including the 400,000 bpd Yulong Petrochemical complex in Shandong, the 300,000-bpd Huajin Aramco Petrochemical Company in Liaoning province in the northeast, and the 320,000-bpd Sinopec Gulei refinery, as well as the 300,000-bpd expansion at Sinopec Zhenhai.翻译:计划新建4座炼油厂，总产能为120万桶/日，包括山东省玉龙石化40万桶/日、辽宁省华锦阿美石化30万桶/日、中石化古雷炼油厂32万桶/日，以及中石化镇海产能扩建30万桶/日。

(ton=7.3 barrels for crude oil conversion)翻译:（吨=7.3桶原油换算）

item.title: 对中国前总理李克强去世的反应
item.description:
Below are reactions to the death on Friday of Chinese former Premier Li Keqiang:翻译:以下是对中国前总理李克强周五去世的反应：

ADAM NI, INDEPENDENT CHINA POLITICAL ANALYST, AUTHOR

"Li was a premier who stood powerless as China took a sharp turn away from reform and opening."翻译:“当中国急剧偏离改革开放时，李克强是一位无能为力的总理。”

DALI YANG, POLITICS PROFESSOR, UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO:翻译:杨大力，芝加哥大学政治学教授：

"The scope for Li's policymaking and implementation had became more subordinated under President Xi Jinping, who had unabashedly dominated in politics and policy making, relegating Li to playing second fiddle.翻译:“在习近平主席的领导下，李克强的政策制定和执行范围变得更加从属，习近平毫不掩饰地主导着政治和政策制定，使李克强沦为次要角色。

"Xi had significantly overshadowed Li, leaving him with less room for initiative than past premiers."翻译:“习近平的光芒明显盖过李克强，使得他的主动行动空间比过去的总理要少。”

CHEN DAOYIN, INDEPENDENT CHINESE POLITICAL ANALYST, CHILE:翻译:智利中国独立政治分析师陈道银：

"Li was someone with ideas but no solutions. He did not achieve much as premier. This is partly his own doing and cannot all be blamed on Xi.翻译:”

"When he first came in power 10 years ago, he had many ideas, such as encouraging entrepreneurship, but no good plan on how to implement them. When these ideas failed to materialise, his power was gradually taken away from him, and he became the most powerless premier in four decades."翻译:“10年前他刚上台时，有很多想法，比如鼓励创业，但没有很好的实施方案。当这些想法未能实现时，他的权力逐渐被夺走，他成了四十年来最无权的总理。”

WEN-TI SUNG, POLITICAL SCIENTIST, AUSTRALIAN NATIONAL UNIVERSITY:翻译:澳大利亚国立大学政治学家 WEN-TI SUNG：

"Li's sudden death definitely came as a surprise, as he was merely 68. Top level Chinese leaders have a track record of longevity - both of Li's last two living predecessors, Premier Zhu Rongji (95) and Premier Wen Jiabao (81), outlive him.翻译:“李克强的突然去世确实令人意外，因为他年仅 68 岁。中国高层领导人都有长寿记录——李克强的最后两位在世前任总理朱镕基 (95 岁) 和总理温家宝 (81 岁) 都比李克强的寿命要长。他。

"Li will probably be remembered as an advocate for the freer market and for the have-nots. But most of all, he will be remembered for what could have been."翻译:“李可能会因为自由市场和穷人的倡导者而被人们铭记。但最重要的是，人们会因为他本来可以做的事情而被人们铭记。”

NEIL THOMAS, FELLOW, ASIA SOCIETY POLICY INSTITUTE'S CENTER FOR CHINA ANALYSIS:翻译:尼尔·托马斯，亚洲社会政策研究所中国分析中心研究员：

"Xi will likely respect party tradition and lead public mourning for Li, as he has no reason to anger Li’s colleagues and supporters in the party, whose waning political influence is further weakened by his death.翻译:“习近平可能会尊重党的传统，并领导公众哀悼李，因为他没有理由激怒李的同事和党内支持者，他们的政治影响力因他的去世而进一步削弱。

"Xi may allow some public mourning for Li but will likely have zero tolerance for attempts to use Li’s death to oppose his leadership."翻译:“习近平可能会允许公众对李鸿章进行一些哀悼，但可能会对利用李鸿章之死反对他的领导的企图采取零容忍态度。”

RICHARD MCGREGOR, SENIOR FELLOW, LOWY INSTITUTE, SYDNEY:翻译:理查德·麦格雷戈，悉尼洛伊研究所高级研究员：

"The reformist era ended a long time ago. I don't think there is any correlation to Hu Yaobang (a political reformer whose death sparked mass mourning and the Tiananmen Square protests) and no heavy symbolic significance attached to Li's funeral.翻译:“改革派时代早已结束。我不认为这与胡耀邦（一位政治改革家，他的去世引发了大规模哀悼和天安门广场抗议活动）有任何关联，李的葬礼也没有重大的象征意义。

"It's a shock because he's relatively young in a system which provides the best healthcare for its leaders."翻译:“这令人震惊，因为在一个为领导人提供最好医疗保健的系统中，他相对年轻。”

YUN SUN, DIRECTOR, STIMSON CENTER, WASHINGTON:翻译:YUN SUN，华盛顿史汀生中心主任：

"Li has been seen as the representative of the reformists. But during his 10 years as the premier, China saw the regression of many policies."翻译:“李克强一直被视为改革派的代表。但在他担任总理的10年里，中国看到了很多政策的倒退。”

CHONG JA IAN, POLITICAL SCIENTIST, NATIONAL UNIVERSITY OF SINGAPORE:翻译:Chong JA IAN，新加坡国立大学政治学家：

"I would not rule out the possibility that a mass mourning triggers some protest, given how there is a degree of unease in the PRC (People's Republic of China) currently...翻译:“鉴于中华人民共和国目前存在一定程度的不安，我不排除大规模哀悼引发一些抗议的可能性......

"The fact that there is so much speculation on Li’s cause of death shows a degree of uncertainty and distrust, that reflects unease over the opaqueness and arbitrariness of the top (Communist Party) leadership, as seen with recent sudden and unexplained removals of leaders.”翻译:“对李的死因有如此多的猜测，这表明了一定程度的不确定性和不信任，这反映出人们对最高层（共产党）领导层的不透明和任意性的不安，正如最近突然且不明原因地罢免领导人的事件所体现的那样。 ”

JOSEPH TORIGIAN, STANFORD HOOVER HISTORY LAB, X POST:翻译:JOSEPH TORIGIAN，斯坦福胡佛历史实验室，X 邮报：

"The passing of a senior Chinese political figure can be a complicated and challenging moment for the leadership. Protests after the deaths of popular former deputies like Zhou Enlai and Hu Yaobang show why. The immediate task facing the Chinese leadership will be to come up with an obituary that pleases Li’s family (which is not always easy, especially if the family is unhappy about something), suits the regime’s political agenda, and does not inflame popular sentiment."翻译:“对于中国领导层来说，一位高级政治人物的去世可能是一个复杂且具有挑战性的时刻。周恩来和胡耀邦等受欢迎的前代表去世后的抗议活动说明了原因。中国领导层面临的直接任务将是拿出一份让李的家人高兴的讣告（这并不总是那么容易，特别是当家人对某件事不满意时），适合该政权的政治议程，并且不会煽动民众情绪。”

KEVIN RUDD, AUSTRALIAN EX-PRIME MINISTER, X POST:翻译:澳大利亚前总理凯文·拉德 (KEVIN RUDD)，X POST：

"Li was warmly disposed to Australia. He also worked closely with the World Bank more than a decade ago on the blueprint for China's economy announced in 2013. We have lost Premier Li far too early in life."翻译:“李克强对澳大利亚很热情。十多年前，他还与世界银行密切合作，制定了2013年公布的中国经济蓝图。我们过早地失去了李克强总理。”

MALCOLM TURNBULL, AUSTRALIAN EX-PRIME MINISTER, X POST:翻译:马尔科姆·特恩布尔，澳大利亚前总理，X POST：

"I always found Premier Li to be a charming and constructive counterparty who was not tied to the official talking points and engaged candidly and thoughtfully on the big issues of the day."翻译:“我一直认为李总理是一位迷人且富有建设性的对手，他不拘泥于官方谈话要点，而是坦诚而深思熟虑地讨论当今的重大问题。”

HIROKAZU MATSUNO, JAPAN'S CHIEF CABINET SECRETARY

"Former Premier Li Keqiang played an important role in Sino-Japanese relations, including his official visit to our country during the trilateral summit between Japan, China and South Korea in May 2018. We hereby offer our sincere condolences and prayers for former Premier Li Keqiang."翻译:“李克强前总理在中日关系中发挥了重要作用，包括在2018年5月日中韩三国领导人峰会期间对我国进行正式访问。在此，我们对李克强前总理表示诚挚的哀悼和祈祷”。

SOUTH KOREAN GOVERNMENT STATEMENT:翻译:韩国政府声明：

"Our government highly values the contribution former Premier Li Keqiang has made on developing South Korea-China relations as a close friend of South Korea. We pray for the eternal repose of his soul and express deep sadness and condolences to the bereaved family."翻译:我国政府高度评价李克强前总理作为韩国的亲密朋友为发展韩中关系作出的贡献，祈愿他的灵魂永息，并向他的家属表示深切的哀悼和慰问。

NICHOLAS BURNS, U.S. AMBASSADOR TO CHINA, X POST

"I extend our condolences to the family of former Premier Li Keqiang, the government of the People's Republic of China, and the Chinese people, on his passing."翻译:“我对前总理李克强的去世向他的家人、中华人民共和国政府和中国人民表示哀悼。”

EUROPEAN UNION CHAMBER OF COMMERCE IN CHINA, STATEMENT:翻译:中国欧盟商会声明：

"The European Chamber is deeply saddened by the passing of former Premier Li Keqiang, who was an important interlocutor for the foreign business community. He was a pragmatic, forward-thinking man who placed great importance on the reform and opening of China’s economy. On the occasions that the European Chamber had the privilege to meet with him, he always paid close attention to the concerns of European companies operating in China."翻译:“中国欧盟商会对前总理李克强的去世深感悲痛，他是外国商界的重要对话者。他是一位务实、有远见的人，高度重视中国经济的改革开放。在中国欧盟商会有幸会见他的场合，他始终密切关注在华经营的欧洲企业所关心的问题。”

AMERICAN CHAMBER OF COMMERCE IN SHANGHAI, STATEMENT:翻译:上海美国商会声明：

"He was well respected by the American business community for his unwavering support for foreign investment in China and for his commitment to the reform and opening policy. His legacy of shaping China’s development will not be forgotten."翻译:“他因坚定支持外国在华投资和致力于改革开放政策而受到美国商界的尊敬。他塑造中国发展的遗产将不会被忘记。”

item.title: 中国推动蒙古加入欧亚安全集团
item.description:
Chinese Premier Li Qiang said China will boost its cooperation with Mongolia under a Eurasian security bloc, which this year admitted its ninth member Iran, gently nudging its smaller neighbour to join a regional group that also includes Russia.翻译:中国总理李强表示，中国将在欧亚安全集团内加强与蒙古的合作，该集团今年接纳了第九个成员国伊朗，温和地推动这个较小的邻国加入一个也包括俄罗斯在内的地区集团。

Mongolia has refrained from joining the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) for almost two decades, choosing to be an observer state since 2004 even as other nations such as India, Pakistan and Iran became full-fledged members.翻译:近二十年来，蒙古一直没有加入上海合作组织（SCO），自 2004 年起选择成为观察员国，尽管印度、巴基斯坦和伊朗等其他国家已成为正式成员。

China is ready to strengthen cooperation with Mongolia under the SCO and other multilateral frameworks to better safeguard their common interests, Li told Mongolian Prime Minister L. Oyun-Erdene on the sidelines of an SCO meeting in Bishkek on Thursday.翻译:李克强周四在比什凯克上合组织会议期间对蒙古国总理奥云额尔登表示，中方愿同蒙古国加强在上合组织和其他多边框架下的合作，更好地维护共同利益。

Oyun-Erdene told Li that Mongolia is ready to work with China to further build up mutual trust while advancing plans to build up the Mongolia-China-Russia economic corridor, without commenting on any plans on being an SCO member.翻译:奥云额尔德尼向李克强表示，蒙古国愿与中方进一步增进互信，推进蒙中俄经济走廊建设，但未对加入上海合作组织的计划发表评论。

In a speech before SCO states in Bishkek, Oyun-Erdene said Mongolia will implement a multi-pillared and independent foreign policy while developing mutually beneficial cooperation with SCO countries.翻译:奥云额尔德尼在比什凯克上合组织成员国会议上发表讲话时表示，蒙古将实行多支柱、独立自主的外交政策，同时发展与上合组织国家的互利合作。

Mongolia has long focused on building bilateral ties with its neighbours and other Asian countries, even entering into tripartite economic and security pacts with its two biggest neighbours China and Russia.翻译:蒙古长期以来一直致力于与邻国和其他亚洲国家建立双边关系，甚至与两个最大邻国中国和俄罗斯签署了三方经济和安全协定。

But it also pursues a so-called "third neighbour" diplomacy in a show of its political independence, forging strategic partnerships with countries such as the United States, Japan and South Korea while resisting calls to join regional security alliances.翻译:但它也推行所谓的“第三邻国”外交，以显示其政治独立，与美国、日本和韩国等国家建立战略伙伴关系，同时抵制加入地区安全联盟的呼声。

The SCO, while not a military alliance, has been expanding cooperation in areas such as counter-terrorism and seeking to enlarge its global influence with new members, offering a Eurasian alternative to Western blocs such as the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).翻译:上合组织虽然不是一个军事联盟，但一直在扩大反恐等领域的合作，并寻求通过新成员扩大其全球影响力，为北大西洋公约组织（北约）等西方集团提供欧亚替代方案。

Reporting by Ryan Woo; Editing by Stephen Coates翻译:瑞安·吴 (Ryan Woo) 报道；斯蒂芬·科茨编辑

item.title: 中国王毅告诉布林肯“深入”对话可以稳定两国关系
item.description:
The United States and China have disagreements and need "in-depth" and "comprehensive" dialogue to reduce misunderstandings and stabilize ties, China's foreign minister, Wang Yi, said on Thursday, kicking off a long-anticipated visit to Washington.翻译:中国外交部长王毅周四表示，美国和中国存在分歧，需要“深入”和“全面”对话，以减少误解、稳定关系，开启期待已久的华盛顿之行。

Standing next to U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken, Wang said the two countries share important common interests and challenges that they need to resolve together.翻译:王毅站在美国国务卿布林肯旁边表示，中美两国拥有重要共同利益，也面临需要共同应对的挑战。

"Therefore, China and the United States need to have dialogue. Not only should we resume dialogue, the dialogue should be in-depth and comprehensive," Wang said, speaking through an interpreter.翻译:“因此，中美之间需要对话。我们不仅应该恢复对话，而且对话应该深入、全面，”王通过翻译说道。

Dialogue would help reduce misunderstandings, help stabilize the relationship and "return it to the track of healthy, stable and sustainable development," he said.翻译:对话有助于减少误解，有助于稳定两国关系，“使两国关系回到健康、稳定、可持续发展的轨道”。

Blinken responded: "I agree with what the foreign minister said."翻译:布林肯回应：“我同意外交部长的说法。”

Before Wang spoke, Blinken had said he looked forward to constructive talks with his Chinese counterpart. During the meeting, Blinken expressed his condolences on the passing of China's former premier, Li Keqiang.翻译:在王发表讲话之前，布林肯曾表示，他期待与中国外长进行建设性会谈。会见中，布林肯对中国前总理李克强的去世表示哀悼。

Wang's three-day visit is the latest in a flurry of diplomatic engagements between the two strategic rivals as they seek to manage their differences to avoid conflict. The trip primarily is to prepare for an expected summit between President Joe Biden and President Xi Jinping in November.翻译:王毅为期三天的访问是这两个战略竞争对手之间一系列外交接触中的最新一次，两国都在寻求管理分歧以避免冲突。此行主要是为预计11月举行的乔·拜登总统和习近平主席峰会做准备。

Blinken and Wang will continue their discussions on Friday.翻译:布林肯和王将于周五继续讨论。

The Israel-Hamas conflict has added a fresh dynamic to the testy relationship of the superpowers, and Washington is hoping Beijing can use its influence with Iran to prevent an escalation into a wider war in the Middle East.翻译:以色列与哈马斯的冲突给超级大国之间紧张的关系增添了新的活力，华盛顿希望北京能够利用其对伊朗的影响力，防止中东地区的战争升级为更广泛的战争。

Wang is expected to meet U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan on Friday. He is also expected to speak with Biden during his visit to the White House, although it is unclear how substantial their interaction will be.翻译:王预计将于周五会见美国国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文。 预计他还将在拜登访问白宫期间与他交谈，尽管目前尚不清楚他们的互动会有多大。

The Biden administration's priority with Beijing has been to prevent intense competition between the two largest economies and disagreements on a host of issues - including trade, Taiwan and the South China Sea - from veering into conflict.翻译:拜登政府与北京的首要任务是防止两个最大经济体之间的激烈竞争以及在贸易、台湾和南海等一系列问题上的分歧演变成冲突。

However, while both Beijing and Washington have spoken of looking for areas where they can work together, and Xi said on Wednesday China was willing to cooperate on global challenges, experts do not expect immediate progress.翻译:然而，尽管北京和华盛顿都谈到寻找可以合作的领域，而且习近平周三表示中国愿意就全球挑战进行合作，但专家预计不会立即取得进展。

PATH TO BIDEN-XI MEETING

Policy analysts in China and the U.S. say both sides share an interest in averting a wider war in the Middle East and that China, as a major oil purchaser, could exert considerable influence on Iran. Whether it will remains to be seen.翻译:中国和美国的政策分析人士表示，避免中东发生更广泛的战争符合双方的共同利益，中国作为主要石油购买国可能对伊朗施加相当大的影响。是否会发生还有待观察。

"The Chinese certainly have an interest in preventing a direct U.S.-Iranian confrontation, as they are major oil consumers and that would spike prices," said Jon Alterman, head of the Middle East program at Washington's Center for Strategic and International Studies.翻译:华盛顿战略与国际研究中心中东项目负责人乔恩·奥尔特曼表示：“中国当然有兴趣阻止美伊直接对抗，因为他们是主要石油消费国，这会导致油价上涨。”

"Still, the Chinese are unlikely to do any heavy lifting here. I expect they'll want a seat at the table when the Israel-Gaza struggle gets resolved, but they don't feel much need or ability to hasten resolution."翻译:“不过，中国人不太可能在这里做任何繁重的工作。我预计，当以色列和加沙的斗争得到解决时，他们会希望在谈判桌上占有一席之地，但他们觉得没有太大的必要或能力来加速解决。”

Shi Yinhong, professor of international relations at Renmin University of China, said Beijing exerting its influence over Iran was "almost the only serious and practical U.S. expectation of China on the Middle East situation."翻译:中国人民大学国际关系教授时殷弘表示，北京对伊朗施加影响“几乎是美国对中国在中东局势上唯一严肃而实际的期望”。

However Shi added: "The U.S. position on Iran is far from acceptable to China and vice versa. Mutual compromise on this issue could be too limited and small to be of any significance."翻译:但史补充道：“美国在伊朗问题上的立场远不能为中国所接受，反之亦然。在这个问题上的相互妥协可能太有限、太小，没有任何意义。”

Wang's visit to Washington comes after several top U.S. officials, including Blinken, visited Beijing in the past several months.翻译:王毅此次访问华盛顿之前，包括布林肯在内的多位美国高级官员在过去几个月访问了北京。

Analysts expect Wang's talks to focus on preparations for an anticipated meeting between Biden and Xi on the sidelines of the summit of Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) countries in San Francisco from Nov. 11 to 17. It would be Biden and Xi's first in-person meeting since a summit in Bali last November.翻译:分析人士预计，王毅的会谈将重点关注拜登和习近平将于 11 月 11 日至 17 日在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 国家峰会期间举行的会晤的准备工作。这将是拜登和习近平的首次会晤。自去年 11 月巴厘岛峰会以来，人们一直在聚会。

The two sides go into APEC from different economic perspectives, with economic policy analysts saying the U.S. has weathered challenging global conditions after the COVID-19 pandemic somewhat better than China.翻译:双方从不同的经济角度讨论 APEC，经济政策分析师表示，在 COVID-19 大流行之后，美国在应对充满挑战的全球形势方面比中国要好一些。

U.S. and Chinese officials held a virtual meeting on Monday on macroeconomic developments.翻译:美国和中国官员周一就宏观经济发展举行了视频会议。

U.S. officials said Taiwan and the South and East China Seas, where they accused Beijing of "destabilizing and dangerous actions" against rival territorial claimants, would also be on the agenda. Re-establishing military-to-military ties with China remains a top priority to avoid unintended conflict, they said.翻译:美国官员表示，台湾和南海和东海问题也将被列入议程，他们指责北京针对敌对领土主张者采取“破坏稳定和危险的行动”。他们表示，与中国重建军事关系仍然是避免意外冲突的首要任务。

Reporting by Humeyra Pamuk and David Brunnstrom in Washington, and Laurie Chen in Beijing; Additional reporting by Simon Lewis, Michael Martina, Trevor Hunnicutt and Gursimran Kaur; Editing by Josie Kao, Tom Hogue and Raju Gopalakrishnan翻译:Humeyra Pamuk 和 David Brunnstrom 在华盛顿以及 Laurie Chen 在北京的报道； Simon Lewis、Michael Martina、Trevor Hunnicutt 和 Gursimran Kaur 的补充报道；编辑：Josie Kao、Tom Hogue 和 Raju Gopalakrishnan

item.title: 政策支持助力9月工业利润延续涨势
item.description:
Profits at China's industrial firms extended gains for a second month in September, adding to signs of a stabilising economy as the authorities launched a burst of supportive policy measures.翻译:9月份，中国工业企业利润连续第二个月上涨，随着当局推出一系列支持性政策措施，增添了经济企稳的迹象。

The 11.9% year-on-year rise came on the back of a surprise 17.2% gain in August, and follows stronger-than-expected industrial and consumption activity over September.翻译:同比增长 11.9% 是在 8 月份意外增长 17.2% 的基础上实现的，而 9 月份工业和消费活动强于预期。

For the first nine months, profits slid 9% from a year earlier, narrowing from a 11.7% decline in the first eight months, data from the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) showed on Friday.翻译:国家统计局周五公布的数据显示，今年前九个月，利润同比下降9%，降幅较前八个月11.7%收窄。

Industrial profits recovered quarter by quarter and swung to a 7.7% growth in the July-September period from declines over the previous two quarters, NBS statistician Yu Weining said in an accompanying statement.翻译:国家统计局统计师于卫宁在随附的声明中表示，工业利润逐季回升，7-9月工业利润增速由前两个季度的下滑转为增长7.7%。

The September number reflects an overall improvement in domestic industrial sector operations and a continued recovery in market demand, said Zhou Maohua, an analyst at China Everbright Bank, adding the slowdown in year-on-year growth was due to a high base last year.翻译:光大银行分析师周茂华表示，9月份的数据反映了国内工业部门运行的整体改善和市场需求的持续复苏，并补充说，同比增长放缓是由于去年基数较高。

A fall in producer prices last month indicated that some industrial firms were still cutting prices to promote sales, putting a drag on overall industrial revenues and profits, Zhou said.翻译:周表示，上个月生产者价格的下降表明一些工业企业仍在降价促销，从而拖累了整体工业收入和利润。

The improvement in industrial profits is expected to sustain in the coming months, partly due to the lag effect in domestic macro pump-priming, he added.翻译:他补充说，预计未来几个月工业利润将持续改善，部分原因是国内宏观拉动的滞后效应。

China's blue chip CSI300 Index (.CSI300) gained 0.6% after opening lower in the morning session.翻译:中国蓝筹股沪深300指数(.CSI300)早盘低开后上涨0.6%。

A run of recent data has pointed to a steadying in the world's second-largest economy, which expanded at a faster-than-expected clip in the third quarter after a rapid loss of momentum following a brief post-COVID bounce.翻译:最近的一系列数据表明，世界第二大经济体正在企稳，在疫情后短暂反弹后迅速失去动力后，第三季度的扩张速度快于预期。

Analysts attribute the stabilisation to a series of policy measures rolled out in the past few months, but the persistent weakness in the crisis-hit property sector remains a major drag on the economy and corporate earnings.翻译:分析师将稳定归因于过去几个月推出的一系列政策措施，但受危机打击的房地产行业持续疲软仍然是经济和企业盈利的主要拖累。

Last week, Chinese battery giant CATL (300750.SZ) reported a sharp slowdown in profit growth in the third quarter, its weakest quarter since the start of last year amid slowing demand and stiff competition.翻译:上周，中国电池巨头宁德时代（300750.SZ）报告称，由于需求放缓和竞争激烈，第三季度利润增长大幅放缓，为去年初以来最疲软的季度。

In his first remarks on policy following third-quarter gross domestic product data, China's central bank governor Pan Gongsheng vowed to bolster the economic recovery, with a focus on expanding domestic demand while curbing financial risks.翻译:中国央行行长潘功胜在第三季度国内生产总值数据公布后首次就政策发表讲话，誓言要促进经济复苏，重点是扩大内需，同时遏制金融风险。

According to a breakdown of the NBS data, state-owned firms saw earnings fall 11.5% in the first nine months, foreign firms booked a 10.5% decline and private-sector companies recorded a 3.2% slide.翻译:根据国家统计局的详细数据，今年前九个月，国有企业利润下降11.5%，外资企业下降10.5%，私营企业下降3.2%。

Industrial profit numbers cover firms with annual revenues of at least 20 million yuan ($2.73 million) from their main operations.翻译:工业利润数据涵盖主营业务年收入至少为 2000 万元人民币（273 万美元）的企业。

($1 = 7.3150 Chinese yuan)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.3150 人民币）

item.title: 恒大本周与债权人举行会谈-彭博新闻
item.description:
China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) held talks this week with creditors who had opposed its restructuring plan, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday citing people familiar with the matter.翻译:据彭博社周四援引知情人士的话报道，中国恒大集团（3333.HK）本周与反对其重组计划的债权人举行了会谈。

Representatives of Evergrande told some investors about the discussions with the creditors who are part of the so-called "Class C" group, the report said, adding that details of the talks were not available.翻译:报道称，恒大代表向一些投资者透露了与所谓“C级”债权人的讨论情况，并补充说，目前尚不清楚谈判的细节。

Last week, Evergrande said it was revising the terms of a proposed offshore debt restructuring deal to meet the firm's situation and creditors' demand.翻译:恒大上周表示，正在修改拟议的离岸债务重组协议的条款，以满足公司的情况和债权人的要求。

item.title: 中国王毅表示，中美需要“全面”对话来稳定关系
item.description:
The United States and China have disagreements but they also share common interests, and the two countries need "in-depth" and "comprehensive" dialogue to reduce misunderstandings and stabilize bilateral relations, China's top diplomat Wang Yi said on Thursday as he began his visit to Washington.翻译:中国最高外交官王毅周四开始访问时表示，美国和中国有分歧，但也有共同利益，两国需要“深入”、“全面”对话，以减少误解、稳定双边关系到华盛顿。

In brief remarks through an interpreter before his meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken at the State Department, Wang said he hoped his discussion with the top U.S. diplomat will be "constructive and forward-looking."翻译:在国务院会见美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯之前，王毅通过翻译发表了简短讲话，他表示希望与美国最高外交官的讨论“具有建设性和前瞻性”。
